title: Private debt funds awash with cash to exploit lending gap
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Private debt funds awash with cash to exploit lending gap Alison Platt, chief executive of Countrywide, which has borrowed from debt funds Richard Pohle/The Times Deirdre Hipwell Published 1 minute ago 
More than $244 billion has been raised during the past five years by the world’s top ten private debt funds, as they seek to exploit a financing gap left by the traditional banks. 
At a time when many companies across Europe are complaining about the difficulties in securing loans from banks to fund growth, a new survey shows that significant pools of private debt have been lined up for investment. Subscribe now
